newsitem.title: USA: TJX sees Q4 oper shr $2.20 to $2.25.
newsitem.headline: TJX sees Q4 oper shr $2.20 to $2.25.

text.p: TJX Cos Inc said Tuesday it expects a strong holiday season to result in a "significant" increase in fourth quarter profits and lead to projected income from continuing operations between $2.20 and $2.25 per share for 1996.
The company said it also expects to see further cost savings from the combination of its T.J. Maxx and Marshalls stores beyond this year.

TJX President and Chief Executive Bernard Cammarata said in a statement that the "store closing program should benefit our bottom line and we will capture the large interest expense savings from repaying substantial debt with the proceeds from the sale of Chadwick's."
In the prior year, the company reported operating income of $84.6 million, or $1.03 per operating share, on revenues of $4.45 billion.
